result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah L. Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct-Loud & Boisterous, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONFRONTATIONAL/ARGUMENTATIVE contact with J. R. as named in the complaint.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.  DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah L. Wilson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:40 PM: Defendant Sarah L. Wilson in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def doese not want counsel today and is prepared to resolve the matter.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea:  NC   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.   Off Record.  Back of Record at 3:20 PM:   Agreement reached on resolution.  State is prepared to move for amendment of charge to allege Loud/Boisterous conduct w/o Enh.  Argues for S/W - 1 yr probation w/conditions.  Statement by Def: None offered.  The Court:  45 days WCJ - I/S - (Huber, GT and No TS credit) - S/W - 1 yr probation.  Conditions:  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; No argumentative contact with J.R.; Court Costs plus  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.
